delete-site-modal.title: Delete Site

accordion.title: Which value is displayed?
accordion.text: The last value measured is displayed. Ideally, data should be transferred every 15 minutes. This constant rate of transmission allows a good estimate of indoor air quality and helps to derive recommendations for action.

accordion.title: Which benchmarks do we use as a guideline?
accordion.text:
We are using the following guideline values which are colour-coded:
CO2 < 1000 ppm -> "good air quality" (blue)
1000 < CO2 < 2000 ppm -> "modest air quality" (yellow)
CO2 > 2000 ppm -> "insufficient air quality" (red)

accordion.title: No value is displayed?
accordion.text: As it goes with prototypes, technical issues are not unlikely. However, if your problem persists for more than 48 hours please inform our COMo team so that we can fix it for you. Send a message to: info@como-berlin.de

accordion.title: Why should I care about my indoor air quality?
accordion.text: We spend nearly 90% of our time indoors. Good indoor air not only enhances our well-being, but also increases learning and work productivity, improves concentration and minimises the risk of viral infections. The CO2 concentration is widely considered a good indicator for general indoor air quality. If you know exactly when the air quality is deteriorating, you can ventilate as needed and ensure that your own premises are perceived as comfortable.

accordion.title: What are the benefits of sharing your results?
accordion.text: Public communication of your indoor air quality data not only allows visitors to find out which operators are sustainably taking care of good air quality, but also helps to bring the important topic of indoor air quality into society. A CO2 traffic light system can only provide information about the current air quality. However, if measurement data is transmitted constantly and over a longer period of time, it allows changes and different activities taking place in the room to be compared.

field_length_mismatch: {field} has to be exaclty {length} characters long.

active.text: Our long-term measurements show that this place is regularly and sufficiently ventilated. You can breathe a sigh of relief!

inactive.text: If a room is well ventilated for more than 30 days at a stretch, it receives our Fresh Air Medal as an award.

download.text: Here you can download all the data recorded by the sensor at once, for browsing and discovering in the convenient CSV file format.

text.low_p1: The CO<sub>2</sub> content of the room is at
text.low_p2: ppm, this corresponds to a normal value and a low aerosol load. The air in the room is good and you can breathe deeply.
text.medium_p1: The CO<sub>2</sub> content of the room is at
text.medium_p2: ppm, this corresponds to a slightly increased value and thus also an increased aerosol load. The room would benefit from a breath of fresh air!
text.high_p1: The CO<sub>2</sub> content of the room is at
text.high_p2: ppm, this corresponds to a very high value and indicates a high aerosol load. Better hold your breath!

error.title: ERROR
error.text: - The sensor is currently taking a break! Unfortunately, no display is possible right now, because no data is sent at the moment.
